byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley, Nikita Stewart and Vivian Yee contributed reporting.

abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo signs executive order that requires local governments, including New York City, to put homeless people on streets in shelter when temperatures are freezing; order allows for use of force if necessary.
lead_paragraph: The executive order, which requires local authorities to remove homeless people from the streets when temperatures fall to 32 degrees, is likely to raise legal concerns and practical questions.

headline.main: Cuomo Orders That Homeless Be Taken to Shelter in Freezing Weather
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Issues Order to Move Homeless Indoors in Freezing Weather

snippet: The executive order, which requires local authorities to remove homeless people from the streets when temperatures fall to 32 degrees, is likely to raise legal concerns and practical questions.
